subject: Re: one-time setup
msgSnippet: ... It sounds like there may be a static (i.e. class variable) somewhere that is persisting that setting between tests. Dave
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Eric Armstrong <eric.armstrong@s...> wrote:

> (The app dies with "invalid program option", because after
> examining the options -- which in this case are correct --
> the program checks to see whether and error has been found.
> With a clean, new ErrorHandler, the error flag is clear. (The
> test ran perfectly until the one ahead of it was added. The
> debugger then showed that the error flag was set when
> running the code.)
>
> To solve the problem, I added this method, and invoked it at
> the beginning of each test method:
> protected void init() {
> commentMerge.errorHandler = new CommentMergeErrorHandler();
> testWriter = new StringWriter();
> commentMerge.setWriter(testWriter);
> }
>
> The tests are now working, but it looks to me like setup() isn't being
> run for each test method.

It sounds like there may be a static (i.e. class variable) somewhere
that is persisting that setting between tests.

Dave
